overview: From 2025-08-12 to 2025-08-13, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 3 new PRs (0 merged), 1 new issues, and 9 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Coordinate GTM tasks for Flashblocks public enablement
topIssues.author: yashvardhan-kukreja
topIssues.body: Assist Sanjana Mehta with tasks and strategies such as docs and coordinating with RaaS providers to get done associated with public GTM strategy for Flashblocks public sepolia.

topPRs.title: Add Calldata Footprint Test Draft
topPRs.author: axelKingsley
topPRs.body:
Draft.

Generates 60 simultaneous transactions with 120KB of data each.
Then, iterates over the chain and evaluates the `gasUsed` field of the block, as well as the accumulated gas and calldata of the transactions.

TODO:

- [x] Perhaps stop using the spammer pattern, and instead manually queue up the transactions (since this can be done inside a single block)
- [ ] Add test asserts after the blocks are created
- [ ] Integrate with the actual feature to confirm it works

topPRs.title: feat: Local op-geth images for kurtosis
topPRs.author: janjakubnanista
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

This PR adds support for local `op-geth` docker images to be used when running kurtosis tests.

Related to https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/16975

topPRs.title: op-node: remove driver.StepEvent
topPRs.author: nonsense
topPRs.body:
TODO:
- [ ] review and fix or remove `TestStepSchedulingDeriver` (mock or some other way)

topContributors.summary: janjakubnanista: Focused on development work, opening PR #17030 "feat: Local op-geth images for kurtosis" in ethereum-optimism/optimism, and made 9 commits modifying 16 files (+51/-27 lines) primarily in configuration files, with a focus on other work and bug fixes.

arisarcmarket: Focused on expanding network capabilities by opening a PR to add an ARCv2 token to the Base network (ethereum-optimism/ethereum-optimism.github.io#1184), and also provided a review comment on another pull request.
nonsense: Focused on other work, opening a PR in ethereum-optimism/optimism (#17024) to remove a driver step event, reflecting their code changes across 5 files.

blmalone: Focused on performance improvements, opening a PR in ethereum-optimism/superchain-ops (#1161) to address intermittent failures impacting developer workflows, reflecting a primary focus on other work.
yashvardhan-kukreja: Focused on strategic coordination, evidenced by the creation of issue ethereum-optimism/optimism#17027 to coordinate GTM tasks for Flashblocks public enablement.
serpixel: Today, serpixel initiated work on porting acceptance tests by creating issue ethereum-optimism/infra#444, indicating a focus on test coverage and system interoperability.
